internationalizations.description:
• Built a full-stack community forum with event posts, second-hand listings, Q&A, and user accounts.
  • Added features including search, reply, user management, and a points-based incentive system.
  • Led team collaboration using GitHub Issues and agile workflows.

• Designed and developed a full-stack community forum supporting event planning, second-hand exchanges, and Q&A discussions.
  • Implemented a complete forum system, including posts, replies, search, user management, and a points-based incentive module.
  • Developed automated tests and test reports for each module to ensure system stability.
  • Led team collaboration via GitHub, utilizing GitHub Issues for task tracking and agile development.

• Built a document management system with Django and PostgreSQL.
  • Containerized services with Docker and managed development with Git.

• Developed a document management system for AASYP, replacing the existing Google Drive system to improve document management and organization.
  • Implemented key features such as OTP-verified login, file upload/download, tag-based search, document version control, and role-based access control.
  • Delivered an MVP that met AASYP’s requirements, receiving very positive feedback from the client.

• Built an AI-powered life simulation game with turn-based movement and dynamic story events.
  • Integrated Google Gemini 2.0 to generate personalized life paths based on player choices.
  • Deployed via WebGL for seamless browser play without installation.

• Developed an AI-powered life simulation game combining Monopoly-style movement with LLM-generated life events.
  • Integrated Google Gemini API to dynamically generate unique, evolving life trajectories based on player choices.
  • Deployed the game via WebGL, making it browser-playable without additional installation.

• Built a command-line toolkit to inspect, clean, and analyze board game metadata.
  • Implemented a custom parser and data normalizer handling ID imputation, encoding cleanup, and format conversion.
  • Used gawk to compute popularity statistics and Pearson correlation coefficients.

• Built a command-line toolkit to inspect, clean, and analyze board game metadata.
  • Implemented a custom parser and data normalizer handling ID imputation, encoding cleanup, and format conversion.
  • Used gawk to compute popularity statistics and Pearson correlation coefficients.

• Led the end-to-end development of an IoT-based smart plant system, integrating C++ firmware on ESP32 microcontrollers with a Flask backend and SQLite database.
  • Implemented MQTT protocols for real-time communication between sensors and server, enabling live control of lighting and watering via REST APIs and WebSockets.
  • Built a responsive web interface using HTML/CSS/JavaScript to display real-time sensor data, 7-day trends, and photo logs, with interactive manual controls.

• Led the end-to-end development of an IoT-based smart plant system, integrating C++ firmware on ESP32 microcontrollers with a Flask backend and SQLite database.
  • Implemented MQTT protocols for real-time communication between sensors and server, enabling live control of lighting and watering via REST APIs and WebSockets.
  • Built a responsive web interface using HTML/CSS/JavaScript to display real-time sensor data, 7-day trends, and photo logs, with interactive manual controls.

• Independently developed the OpenMalaria AI chatbot from scratch to production.
  • Built core RAG logic and embedded domain-specific literature for contextual answers.
  • Implemented XML validation for malaria model inputs.
  • Added user management, logging, and server deployment features.
  • Continuously improved the system based on user testing and researcher feedback.
  • Maintained stable deployment on a remote Linux server.
